intro: Phelipanche muteliformis, commonly known as the common morning glory, is a flowering plant belonging to the Convolvulaceae family. It is characterized by its trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in the morning, hence its common name. The plant is native to various regions in Europe and Asia and is often found growing along roadsides and in disturbed soils. Its stems are hairy and tend to twine around supporting structures, while its leaves are heart-shaped and alternate. The plant is known for its rapid growth and can become invasive in certain environments.
